script.name: !move.follow.template

argument.name: stopwhendocked
argument.desc: stop if leader is docked at same

script.sourceplaintext:
skip if $target -> exists return null skip if $target -> is of class Ship return null
$followonly = ! ( $attacknearest OR $attacksame OR $protectit ) if not $target -> is of class Fighter Drone if not $target -> is of class Freight Drone $isnodrone = [TRUE] end end
$oldowner = $target -> get owner race skip if $oldowner == [OWNER] OR $oldowner != Pirates [THIS] ->set pirate cover state to [FALSE]
if $oldowner == [OWNER] AND $target != [THIS] [THIS] ->add to formation with leader $target else [THIS] ->remove from any formation end
while 1 if not [THIS] -> is in active sector @ = wait 2000 ms else if not $retvar == FLRET_TARGETREACHED * fixes "follower speed jumping" bug while keeping up performance @ = wait randomly from 50 to 100 ms else $retvar = null end
skip if [THIS] == $target OR $oldowner != [OWNER] $target = [THIS] -> get formation leader
skip if $target -> exists break
$curowner = $target -> get owner race if not $curowner == $oldowner do if $curowner == Pirates [THIS] ->set pirate cover state to [FALSE] skip if [OWNER] == $curowner break end [THIS] ->set command target: $target
$targetdockedat = $target -> is docked $sector = $target -> get sector $target.action = $target -> get current action
if [DOCKEDAT] if [DOCKEDAT] == $targetdockedat if $stopwhendocked $cmd = $target -> get command * stopwhendocked is not used in job commands anymore, because followers left their * formations when docking and would not get restarted. $jobleader = [THIS] -> get job leader do if $cmd == COMMAND_NONE OR $jobleader break end if [DOCKEDAT] -> is in active sector @ = wait randomly from 5000 to 7000 ms else @ = wait randomly from 25000 to 35000 ms end else if [DOCKEDAT] == $target if $target -> is docked @ = wait randomly from 5000 to 7000 ms continue end if $target.action == [ACTION_LAND_IN_STATION] AND $stopwhendocked @ = [THIS] -> call script !move.undock : else * undock at leader if enemy in sight if $target -> find nearest enemy ship: max.dist=8000 @ = [THIS] -> call script !move.undock : else @ = wait randomly from 4000 to 8000 ms end end else @ = [THIS] -> call script !move.undock : end
else if ! $targetdockedat AND $sector == [SECTOR] * i am not docked and target is in same sector
if $target.action == [ACTION_LAND_IN_STATION] if $target -> get destination $target.dest = $target -> get destination * if target is docking, wait nearby until target is docked skip if [THIS] -> has same environment as $target.dest continue $target.dist = get distance between [THIS] and $target.dest if $target.dist <= 2000 @ = [THIS] -> move around 5000 ms continue end end end
$attacker = null $escorttime = random value from 60000 to 120000 - 1 do if [THIS] -> is in active sector $escorttime = random value from 6000 to 12000 - 1 if not $followonly if $protectit $attacker = $target -> get attacker end if $attacker == null AND $attacknearest $range = [THIS] -> get scanner range $attacker = $target -> find nearest enemy ship: max.dist=$range end if $attacker == null AND $attacksame if $target == [PLAYERSHIP] $attacker = get player tracking aim else $attacker = $target -> get attack target end end if $attacker if not $target -> is $attacker a enemy $attacker = null else do if $attacker -> is of class Ship [THIS] ->set relation against $attacker to Foe skip if [THIS] -> is $attacker a enemy $attacker = null end end * faster response end if $attacker do if [THIS] -> is in active sector $escorttime = random value from 6000 to 10000 - 1 * keep formation until we are near to attack if [THIS] == $target OR $target == [PLAYERSHIP] @ = [THIS] -> call script !fight.attack.object : the victim=$attacker follow in new sector=null else * first check they are in the same sector $dist = -1 do if [THIS] -> has same environment as $attacker $dist = get distance between [THIS] and $attacker
* Brent: followers have trouble when escorting big ships, where engagement * ranged tend to be well over the 3km requirement of this check. * To work more intelligently, this will be bumped up based on the escort * ships general type. * Start by selecting the distance to check and putting it in temp. * Note: in testing, it seems as if Huge Ship is a child class of * Big Ship, instead of independent, so check Huge first, then fall * back to Big. if $target -> is of class Huge Ship * For capital tier, aim for a bit beyond PPC range (6.6km). $temp = 7011 else if $target -> is of class Big Ship * For corvette tier, aim for a bit beyond CIG range (3.4km). $temp = 4011 else * Default remains at 3km, about 30% beyond hept range (2.3km). $temp = 3011 end * Now do the distance check as normal. if $dist != -1 AND $dist <= $temp @ = [THIS] -> call script !fight.attack.object : the victim=$attacker follow in new sector=null else @ $retvar = [THIS] -> escort ship $target: timeout=$escorttime ms continue end end else if [THIS] == $target do if [THIS] -> is in active sector $escorttime = random value from 3000 to 6000 - 1 @ = [THIS] -> move around $escorttime ms continue else $owner = $target -> get owner race if $owner != [OWNER] AND $owner == Pirates [THIS] ->set pirate cover state to [FALSE] end if [THIS] == [PLAYERSHIP] AND $followonly $size = [THIS] -> get size of object $sizetarget = $target -> get size of object $size = ( $size + $sizetarget ) / 2 * 3 + 120 $sizetarget = $target -> get current speed $size = $size + $sizetarget / 2 @ $retvar = [THIS] -> follow $target with precision $size m : timeout=60000 ms else * dock at leader if no enemy in sight * FIX (13): Added check for freight drone if not [THIS] -> is of class Freight Drone $range = $target -> get scanner range if not $target -> find nearest enemy ship: max.dist=$range $range = [THIS] -> get scanner range if not [THIS] -> find nearest enemy ship: max.dist=$range $target.action = $target -> get current action if $target.action != [ACTION_LAND_IN_STATION] if $target -> is docking possible of [THIS] do if $target -> has a free ship dock port: ship subtype = [THIS] @ = [THIS] -> call script !move.movetostation : station=$target end end end end end skip if [ENVIRONMENT] == $target OR ! $target @ = [THIS] -> escort ship $target: timeout=$escorttime ms end continue end end else
* i am not docked and target is docked or in an other sector
if $sector == [SECTOR] if $target.action == [ACTION_START_IN_STATION] @ = [THIS] -> move around 5000 ms else if not [THIS] -> has same environment as $targetdockedat @ = [THIS] -> move around 15000 ms else $dist = get distance between [THIS] and $targetdockedat if $dist <= 6500 AND $isnodrone * wait outside for 15 seconds, then follow ship to dock @ = [THIS] -> move around 15000 ms skip if $target -> exists continue if $target -> is docked do if $targetdockedat -> has a free ship dock port: ship subtype = [THIS] @ = [THIS] -> fly to station $targetdockedat end else @ $retvar = [THIS] -> follow object $targetdockedat with precision 5000 m end end end else @ = [THIS] -> call script !move.movetonextsector : sector=$sector destination=$target end end end return null
* changelog * 6. added wait if tagret is docking. should reduce followers coliding with docks * + added followers not docking if target is launching. * 7. dock at leader if no enemy in sight * + added followers not docking if target might launch before they arrive * 8. do not dock at leader when no free dock port (commented out: command broken) * + don't try to attack an enemy that is not a foe (used to impact performance) * 9. fixed "speed jumping for playership"-bug * 10. major performance fix (wait 2000ms) * 11. stopped followers landing while leader is docking * 13: Added check for freight drone trying to dock

comment.var: fixes "follower speed jumping" bug while keeping up performance
stopwhendocked is not used in job commands anymore, because followers left their
formations when docking and would not get restarted.
undock at leader if enemy in sight
i am not docked and target is in same sector
if target is docking, wait nearby until target is docked
faster response
keep formation until we are near to attack
first check they are in the same sector
Brent: followers have trouble when escorting big ships, where engagement
ranged tend to be well over the 3km requirement of this check.
To work more intelligently, this will be bumped up based on the escort
ships general type.
Start by selecting the distance to check and putting it in temp.
Note: in testing, it seems as if Huge Ship is a child class of
Big Ship, instead of independent, so check Huge first, then fall
back to Big.
For capital tier, aim for a bit beyond PPC range (6.6km).
For corvette tier, aim for a bit beyond CIG range (3.4km).
Default remains at 3km, about 30% beyond hept range (2.3km).
Now do the distance check as normal.
dock at leader if no enemy in sight
FIX (13): Added check for freight drone

line.text: has a free ship dock port: ship subtype =

comment.var: i am not docked and target is docked or in an other sector
wait outside for 15 seconds, then follow ship to dock

line.text: has a free ship dock port: ship subtype =

comment.var: changelog
6. added wait if tagret is docking. should reduce followers coliding with docks
+ added followers not docking if target is launching.
7. dock at leader if no enemy in sight
+ added followers not docking if target might launch before they arrive
8. do not dock at leader when no free dock port (commented out: command broken)
+ don't try to attack an enemy that is not a foe (used to impact performance)
9. fixed "speed jumping for playership"-bug
10. major performance fix (wait 2000ms)
11. stopped followers landing while leader is docking
13: Added check for freight drone trying to dock

sval.val: Low level follow code
target ship
protect the ship
attack same target
attack nearest enemy
stop if leader is docked at same
fixes "follower speed jumping" bug while keeping up performance
stopwhendocked is not used in job commands anymore, because followers left their
formations when docking and would not get restarted.
undock at leader if enemy in sight
i am not docked and target is in same sector
if target is docking, wait nearby until target is docked
faster response
keep formation until we are near to attack
first check they are in the same sector
Brent: followers have trouble when escorting big ships, where engagement
ranged tend to be well over the 3km requirement of this check.
To work more intelligently, this will be bumped up based on the escort
ships general type.
Start by selecting the distance to check and putting it in temp.
Note: in testing, it seems as if Huge Ship is a child class of
Big Ship, instead of independent, so check Huge first, then fall
back to Big.
For capital tier, aim for a bit beyond PPC range (6.6km).
For corvette tier, aim for a bit beyond CIG range (3.4km).
Default remains at 3km, about 30% beyond hept range (2.3km).
Now do the distance check as normal.
dock at leader if no enemy in sight
FIX (13): Added check for freight drone
i am not docked and target is docked or in an other sector
wait outside for 15 seconds, then follow ship to dock
6. added wait if tagret is docking. should reduce followers coliding with docks
+ added followers not docking if target is launching.
7. dock at leader if no enemy in sight
+ added followers not docking if target might launch before they arrive
8. do not dock at leader when no free dock port (commented out: command broken)
+ don't try to attack an enemy that is not a foe (used to impact performance)
9. fixed "speed jumping for playership"-bug
10. major performance fix (wait 2000ms)
11. stopped followers landing while leader is docking
13: Added check for freight drone trying to dock
